name: git-clone

options.-q, --quiet: Only print error and warning messages.
<repository>: The (remote) repository to clone from, usually in the form of a
<directory>: The name of a new directory to clone into. By default it is the

short_desc: Clones a repository into a new directory
long_desc: Clones a repository. Tracking of remote branches are set up and the
command also checks out an initial branch, often the master branch
After the clone, a plain 'git fetch' is performed to update all
tracked branches after which a plain 'git pull' will merge the
remote master branch into the local master branch.

examples.1:
1. Clone with HTTPS:
git clone https://github.com/doc97/gdc-bot
examples.2:
2. Clone with SSH:
git clone git@github.com:doc97/gdc-bot
